item.title: Schroders Closing Its Australian Private Debt Business
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Schroders Plc is closing its Australian private-debt business, citing intense competition for fund raising and sourcing investments. The Australian private debt market is an increasingly competitive space, Schroders Australia CEO and chief investment officer Simon Doyle said in an e...

item.title: ECB to Start Publishing Key Wage Gauge Informing Rate Decisions
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank will regularly make available one of its most valued trackers of wage increases in the euro zone, providing insight into the analysis that shapes monetary-policy decisions. The indicator will be published at 10 a.m. on Wednesdays that follow Governing Council...

item.title: BlackRock ETF Buys First Muni Bonds Issued Through Blockchain
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A BlackRock Inc. fund has bought municipal debt issued earlier this year in a first-of-its-kind deal that relies exclusively on blockchain technology. BlackRock purchased the bonds through an actively-managed exchange-traded fund called the iShares Short Maturity Municipal Bond Active...

item.title: Dutch See Insufficient Evidence to Prosecute Ex-UBS CEO Hamers
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Ralph Hamers, the former chief executive officer of Swiss lender UBS Group AG and Dutch lender ING Groep NV, can start looking past a long legal case in the Netherlands. Dutch prosecutors said in a statement Wednesday they will ask the relevant court that Hamers “will not be prosecute...

item.title: ECB Pitches Plan to Boost Insurance Coverage for Climate Losses
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank and the region’s insurance authority proposed a two-pronged approach to increase insurance coverage for floods, storms and other weather disasters that are increasingly being fueled by climate change. One part of the plan is a voluntary public-private reinsur...

item.title: ECB Must Stay Agile Cutting Rates in Uncertain World, Lane Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank must keep an open mind about the pace of interest-rate cuts as lingering risks in the global economy could still shift the outlook for inflation, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane. Wage growth, profits and geopolitical tensions could push up energy pri...

item.description: (Bloomberg) -- There is arguably no leader in all of Europe who’s more chummy, or ideologically aligned, with Donald Trump than Hungary’s Viktor Orban. Which goes a long way to explaining why at a time when the mood is markedly glum across European financial markets, there is a sense of optimism in ...

item.description: Selten waren die Rahmenbedingungen für ein neues Jahr so schwer einzuschätzen wie zum Jahreswechsel 2024/2025: Deutschland steckt tief in einer Wirtschaftskrise, fast täglich gibt es neue Hiobsbotschaften, die Regierung ist zerbrochen. Welche neue politische Konstellation die Neuwahl des Bundestags ...
